title: Hotel shooting leaves teen hospitalized
content:
A teenager hospitalized early Sunday morning with a gunshot wound to the face was shot accidentally, police said.
The teen, a 13-year-old male from Elkhart, is listed in “stable condition” with a “superficial” injury to the face, St. Joseph County Police Lt. Bill Redman said.
The victim was in a room at the Quality Inn in Roseland with “eight to people” ranging in age “from 13 to 19” at about 6:45 a.m. Sunday morning when “it appears that a weapon was displayed, and it appears that it was an accident shooting,” Redman said.
Redman added that details are still sketchy about why the juveniles were in the room, who rented the room, and the shooter, whose identification remains unknown to police.
“If it was a juvenile, we can’t talk to them without their parents present,” Redman said.
Sunday morning at around 10 a.m., St. Joseph County Sheriff’s deputies continued to collect evidence on the scene at Quality Inn.
According to Redman, police were still in the process of reaching out to parents of all those in the room at the time of the shooting, “trying to determine who actually rented the hotel room and who that (shooter) was.”
Redman noted that the shooting was an isolated incident, and it still under investigation.
“We’re still interviewing people who were in the room,” Redman said, “and talking with people who were there, along with parents.”
